
A careless developer reused a prime when generating RSA keys for different users. An encrypted flag awaits: ciphertext1: 5073317646083151921130590129327538275086233087917560775225680077809912165449278648910553271624654023105225684781938308084708157024891570144632201114063937, ciphertext2: 4569931373689242898056160696788504049349849006560897950873231287042639358307754906913568854896226818531858620981263841945825677565251581214999243230392068


The flag format is flag{...}
n1=6940263866421563222097298099609560299388598671019172624965207566167400900472349603996750931369433434868861165184645840832381006752019847975183773879854539, n2=5119193620497112182036432013117425807334583266295909051078490529863001691404368605635205614309989312007604014355680130963710119019427959780343998642777099, e=912933829386789326147406939074615074716943846354385044800717374324343502704915820584051731468766663284669154324112075496794735276195828365083814663916517

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{0qd5oion}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: ciphertext1: 5073317646083151921130590129327538275086233087917560775225680077809912165449278648910553271624654023105225684781938308084708157024891570144632201114063937, ciphertext2: 4569931373689242898056160696788504049349849006560897950873231287042639358307754906913568854896226818531858620981263841945825677565251581214999243230392068
vulnerability: common factors
hint: When two RSA moduli share a common factor, computing GCD(n1, n2) can reveal the shared prime factor.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n1=6940263866421563222097298099609560299388598671019172624965207566167400900472349603996750931369433434868861165184645840832381006752019847975183773879854539, n2=5119193620497112182036432013117425807334583266295909051078490529863001691404368605635205614309989312007604014355680130963710119019427959780343998642777099, e=912933829386789326147406939074615074716943846354385044800717374324343502704915820584051731468766663284669154324112075496794735276195828365083814663916517
